alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 3:27PM CDT until April 07 at 7:37PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Catoma Creek Near The U.S. 331 Highway Bridge affecting Montgomery County. .Recent heavy rainfall has fallen over the Catoma Creek basin and a flood warning is now in effect for the Catoma Creek. Another statement will be issued by Thursday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING INTO THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Catoma Creek Near The U.S. 331 Highway Bridge. * WHEN...From this evening into Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Flooding of agricultural lands in the vicinity of the U.S. 331 Highway Bridge occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 18.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 20.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage during Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
